website_summaries.verdict: The HP ScanJet Pro 3500 f1 Flatbed Scanner combines a flatbed and an automatic document feeder (ADF), has a good software suite, and offers USB 3.0 connectivity.
cons: Very slow in scanning to searchable PDF with default settings

customer_reviews.title: Breaks down with BLACK THICK LINE on scans render USELESS --updated
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic works well and fast. I had an older HP multifunction that was terrible this does everything quickly for 15 months. Well after 15 months duplex portion has a possible bulb burn now I can only scan one sided images because on duplex a thick black line appears on right side rendering scan useless. FLAT bed scan also has that same THICK BLACK LINE rendering ALL SCANS useless. This should be a class action suit as it seems ALL scanners have this issue after at least 14 months. DO NOT BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.author: TrustmeReview

customer_reviews.title: Intrusive but tolerable software
customer_reviews.text: It's faster than the more expensive Fujitsu I otherwise would have bought -- after two Fujitsus in a row -- but its "HP Scan" software clashes with Nuance PaperPort's -- by far my preferred document manager -- whose native software offers much more nuance [sic] in controlling a greater variety of scanning tasks. HP Scan can be interdicted but that's a hassle I would have preferred to avoid altogether.
customer_reviews.author: teag

customer_reviews.title: Defective design leads to short product life
customer_reviews.text: I was initially quite pleased with this efficient scanner that produced high-quality images. But, apparently like many other purchasers, my unit started outputting this thick, black vertical line on every scan just a little while after the warranty expired.
customer_reviews.author: James R

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased September of 2018. Today, I get a thick black vertical inch line down the left side of the scanned page. I tried cleaning the unit per HP instructions with no success. My opinion, it's a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: M. Roy

customer_reviews.title: ... one does one side and the sheet feed is awesome.
customer_reviews.text: does 2 sides faster than my old one does one side and the sheet feed is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: RSpeedyG

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre at best -
customer_reviews.text: ScanJet Pro 3500 f1 Flatbed - Purchased in mid-2017, died in early 2020 under extremely light use. Doc feeder worked well and scans were clean. Had to re-load the software drivers about every 6 months as they became corrupted. Developed pin-lines in scans when run through the feeder and black 2-3 inch bars when using the flat-bed about 6 months ago. Originally purchased for mid-$400's. Definitely not worth the price - then or now.
customer_reviews.author: East Bay Mike

customer_reviews.title: Fit tight work space requirement
customer_reviews.text: It fit our available work space. Have been using it for approx. month now and haven't heard any complaints from users.
customer_reviews.author: thomas od

customer_reviews.title: Small and fast
customer_reviews.text: By comparison the one we were replacing was huge and heavy. This costs less and is faster ... go figure. The computer interface is a little clunkier but it works fine. It goes to sleep sometimes and I have to power it back on but it comes up fast so that is no big deal and maybe that will extend its life. We've only had it a few months but so far so good - we use it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Thomaas M. Matthews

customer_reviews.title: NOT A GOOD SELLER
customer_reviews.text: THIS SCANNER NEVER, EVER WORKED. TROUBLESHOOTING, APP DOWNLOADS, DRIVER DOWNLOADS, UPDATES. NEVER DID WORK. I'M VERY DISGUSTED.
customer_reviews.author: SARAH T.

customer_reviews.title: Great but only for 2 yrs
customer_reviews.text: This is a great scanner but it lasts exactly 2 years before it crumps. The first one did and I thought it my be a fluke. My office manager loved it so much I bought another. Here we are...just over 2 years later and we're having issues. No more for us :(
customer_reviews.author: The_Arab_Cowgirl

customer_reviews.title: It was a fast replacement for my old HP Scanjet ...
customer_reviews.text: It was a fast replacement for my old HP Scanjet 3500c Scanner. I had all the software and all I needed to do was to plug it in. I had my old one for 13 years. I believe this one will last for a least 5. If so I got my moneys worth out of HP.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Good hardware, very poor software.
customer_reviews.text: Scanner very good, HP scanning software definitely sub-par. Scan files are gigantic and basically unusable for small business since they need to be emailed. Was forced to acquire software from another vendor to compress output files, so now sort of a two step process. Major step backwards on software from previous HP two sided scanner. HP scan software also inverts some documents when there is an image on a printed page. This is much more of a problem than with previous HP scanner. Very disappointed in the HP software necessary to make this product function.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HP 3500C Scanjet
customer_reviews.text: I have used this type scanner for several years. It does about average job scanning items how ever it is slow on start up. I like the features of the HP director folder. Can not be used for faxing documents.
customer_reviews.author: Kelvin Kestner

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves it.
customer_reviews.text: In less than a month my husband has already scanned more than 500 antique and more recent family photos with it, dating from the 1890's to present. It is portable and has allowed him to work on this masssive and still-incomplete project in various locations. The photos have provided us many a fun jaunt down memory (and pre-memory) lane as they are projected in slide shows on his computer screen. The scanner is perfect for this application.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Stanton

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the quality of the scanned copies and the speed
customer_reviews.author: Giuseppi Cusumano

customer_reviews.title: Can't Scan with Sheet Feeder in Black and White
customer_reviews.text: This scanner works great for grayscale images. However, every time I try to use the sheet feeder to scan in black and white, it stops after 3 pages and only records the first page. I've tried multiple applications (NAPS2, Adobe Acrobat, Device Interface) and they all do the same thing. Probably 1 in 10 times I am able to scan from the feeder in black and white. This with Windows 10, latest HP drivers (from Feb, 2016), USB 3.0 connection. HP please fix this!
customer_reviews.author: kathryn zimmons

customer_reviews.title: The scanner its self is a good product, but HP needs to actually check the ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scanner because of the HP name. The scanner its self is a good product, but HP needs to actually check the software that they ship with it. The Readis software bundled with the scanner does not work. You cannot create a PDF from Adobe Acrobat using this scanner. It says it cannot communicate with it. That leaves the HP software, which works sometimes and sometimes it doesn't. You would think that a company like could get their act together. I am trying to operate this on a HP XW8600 workstation, two Intel zeon processors, Window 10 Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Gardiner

customer_reviews.title: Terrible for photos
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize a scanner at this price point could do such a poor job of photo resolution. it doesn't matter what settings I use, the contrast is too strong and there seems to be no way to fix it. Even changing contrast has little effect on the results. HP support blamed it on the age of the scanner but my much older Canon far surpassed this on. I had to purchase another scanner just for pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Burns

customer_reviews.title: Sorry: I cannot agree with the other reviewers
customer_reviews.text: I pulled this baby out of the box, put the CD in my computer, followed instructions on the screen and within 10 minutes I was scanning pictures. You want to talk about a BAAAAD scanner, talk about Microtek's: HP Scanjet rocks! Quality was great, the Scanning interface that pulls up when you do "Import..." in Adobe Photoshop was very nice and intuitive. All in all, if you have never scanned images in your life, or if you're an expert for all matters and purposes, this is a great bang for your buck. Happy scanning!
customer_reviews.author: Manny H.

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied with the scanner
customer_reviews.text: The ADF is very fast and reliable. It never had any paper jam since it arrived at my office.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Good scans, below average s/w
customer_reviews.text: Bought this used to replace a dying scanner. When starting, it asks to set everything up all the time. The scans themselves are fine, but when trying to scan multiple pages (one at a time), this is annoying to have to reset the size and dpi EVERY TIME. Got the s/w from the HP website. Worse, I use IRFANVIEW for my imaging editing and this s/w will not let me choose that to edit.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph St Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Another HP Scanner in the garbage
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd HP scanner. The first was the top of the line scanner of 1999. After a year it just stopped working. The bed lit up but then it would say "cannot find scanner." Even HP tech support couldn't figure it out. I got this one for Xmas, used it a handful of times, now I get a strange clicking sound and no scanned product. HP is sending me a new one... Maybe I should just buy a digital camera instead....... I will steer clear if HP scanners from now on...
customer_reviews.author: Webbhead

customer_reviews.title: A good little machine.
customer_reviews.text: We didn't have a lot of money but wanted a good little machine. This Hp scanner did the trick. It's nice looking and performs well. Our scanning needs are not to aggresive. But we do use it a lot for pictures and record keeping. It's worth the price for the average PC user.
customer_reviews.author: Niny97

customer_reviews.title: Don't Knock This Unit!
customer_reviews.text: Some people have really knocked this unit in the reviews. I really know nothing about scanners but have wanted one for some time. I literally pulled the unit out of the box and started scanning after ten minutes of setup up time. I will agree that it probably is not the fastest scanner on the market but it does one hell of a job. I will probably invest in a better photo editing suit but I am definitely impressed. I just scanned a wedding picture and the resolution of the scan is just as clear as the picture itself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great with MY Mac OSX!
customer_reviews.text: This little scanner is fabulous. I was prepared for a painful installation and start-up process, but it was quite simple and easy. The scans are beautifully clean and clear - far superior to the $800 scanner at my work. I use an HP 940 printer, and this yields high quality scanned & printed pics.
customer_reviews.author: Margaux Laskey

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've used this scanner for archiving old photos, general scanning, and importing line art for coloring in Photoshop & GIMP. I've been very happy with it. The resolution & color quality is great for my uses and it's reasonably fast too. I have used this scanner on 3 different PCs and haven't had a single setup issue. You can get these for a great price here so they're definitely worth checking out.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Donahue

product_meta.title: HP ScanJet Pro 3500 f1 Flatbed OCR Scanner
product_meta.description: Get fast, two-sided scanning at up to 50 images (25 pages) per minute. This scanner was designed to handle up to 3,000 sheets per day. HP EveryPage helps avoid missing pages and misfeeds.
feature_bullets: Speeds: Achieve scan speeds up to 25 pages per minute, 50 images per minute, and 3,000 pages per day with single pass, 2 sided scanning to help automate workflows
Auto document feeder: Load up to 50 pages for fast, unattended scanning
Software features: Automatic crop, exposure, orient, plus background cleanup & removal, blank page & hole removal, edge erase, merge pages, straighten content, color drop out
Scan to: Use scan profiles for recurring jobs or send directly to email, Dropbox, Google Drive, network, local drive, multiple destinations

Paper sizes supported: Letter, legal, executive, business cards, 4x6, 6x8, 7x10; handles paper sizes up to 122 inches; HP EveryPage allows scanning of mixed sizes and types of paper with minimized chance of a misfeed
Paper types: Paper (banner, inkjet, photo, plain), envelopes, labels, cards (greeting, index, business)
Warranty: 1 year limited hardware warranty; phone and 24 hour, 7 days a week Web support included
Save time: Create up to 7 1 button scan profiles for recurring tasks from LCD control panel

specifications.Customer reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
